qahramon

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Character
      • qahramon.Monster

  • public class Monster
extends Character
    A class of monsters as special kinds of characters involving capacity, protection and damage.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariants:
  • Each monster must have a valid damage.
        isValidDamage(getDamage())
  • Each monster must have a valid protection.
        isValidProtection(getProtection())
  • Each monster must have a valid capacity.
        isValidCapacity(getCapacity())

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Monster(java.lang.String name, int hitpoints, int damage, int protection, int numberOfAnchors, float capacity)
      Create a monster with a given name, amount of hitpoints, damage, protection, number of anchors and capacity.
      Monster(java.lang.String name, int hitpoints, int damage, int protection, int numberOfAnchors, float capacity, java.util.HashSet<Item> items)
      Create a monster with a given name, amount of hitpoints, damage, protection, number of anchors, capacity and given items, which are randomly distributed on the anchors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monster

        public Monster(java.lang.String name,
               int hitpoints,
               int damage,
               int protection,
               int numberOfAnchors,
               float capacity,
               java.util.HashSet<Item> items)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a monster with a given name, amount of hitpoints, damage, protection, number of anchors, capacity and given items, which are randomly distributed on the anchors.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this monster
        hitpoints - the maximum amount of hitpoints of this monster
        damage - the damage of this monster
        protection - the protection of this monster
        numberOfAnchors - the number of anchors of this monster
        capacity - the carry capacity of this monster
        items - the given set of items of this monster
        Preconditions:
      • The given damage must be valid.
            isValidDamage(damage)
      • The given protection must be valid.
            isValidProtection(protection)   The given set of items for this monster to carry.
      • The given number of anchors is equal to or higher than the amount of items to equip.
            numberOfAnchors >= items.size()
        • Postconditions:
      • The capacity of this monster is set to the given capacity, if the capacity can handle the total weight of the given items. If not the capacity is set to the total weight of the given items.
      • The damage of this monster is set to the given damage.
            new.getDamage() == damage
      • The protection of this monster is set to the given protection.
            new.getProtection() == protection
        • Effects:
      • The new monster is set as a character with a given name, amount of hitpoints and a number of anchors.
            super(name, hitpoints, numberOfAnchors)
      • Each item given in this constructor will be equipped in a random slot when possible, otherwise nothing happens.
            for each (Item item : items)
             equip(randomSlotId, item)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • Monster

        public Monster(java.lang.String name,
               int hitpoints,
               int damage,
               int protection,
               int numberOfAnchors,
               float capacity)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a monster with a given name, amount of hitpoints, damage, protection, number of anchors and capacity.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this monster
        hitpoints - the maximum amount of hitpoints of this monster
        damage - the damage of this monster
        protection - the protection of this monster
        numberOfAnchors - the number of anchors of this monster
        capacity - the carry capacity of this monster
        Effect:
        The new monster is set as a character with a given name, amount of hitpoints, a number of anchors and no items attached.
            this(name, hitpoints, damage, protection, numberOfAnchors, capacity, new HashSet())
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • isValidDamage

        public static boolean isValidDamage(int damage)
        Return true when the given damage is valid.
        Parameters:
        damage - the damage to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given damage is positive. Return false otherwise.
            damage >= getMinimumDamage() && damage <= getMaximumDamage()

      • wantsToTake

        public boolean wantsToTake(Item item)
        Check whether the monster wants to take the given item.
        Specified by:
        wantsToTake in class Character
        Returns:
        Return true when the given item is an armor and the random percentage is lower than the ratio between the protection and the fullProtection of the armor. Return true when the given item is a weapon and the random percentage is lower than 80. Return true when the given item is a backpack and the random percentage is lower than 10. Return true when the given item is a purse and the random percentage is lower than 20. Return false otherwise.
        Note:
        The more shiny an item is, the more likely the monster wants to take it.

      • collectTreasure

        public void collectTreasure(Item item)
        Pick up the item when this character wants to take it.
        Specified by:
        collectTreasure in class Character
        Parameters:
        item - the treasure to collect
        Effects:
      • When this monster wants to take an item it will be picked up
            if (wantsToTake(item)) then
             pickUp(item)
      • When this monster doesn't want to take an armor or weapon it will be terminated
            if (!wantsToTake(item) && (item.isArmor() || item.isWeapon())) then
             item.terminate()
      • When this monster doesn't want to take a backpack then all its stored armors and weapons will be terminated
            if (!wantsToTake(item) && item.isBackpack()) then
             ((Backpack)item).terminateWeaponsAndArmor()

      • hit

        public void hit(Character character)
         throws DeadException
        This monster hits the given character.
        Specified by:
        hit in class Character
        Parameters:
        character - the character to hit
        Postconditions:
      • When the given character dies, this monster's fighting state will be set to false
            new.isFighting() == false
      • When the given character dies, this monster's amount of hitpoints will be set to the first found lower prime.
            new.getHitpoints() == MathHelper.getLowerPrime(getHitpoints(), 0)
        • Effects:
      • A random number between 0 and 100 is generated, when this number is below the current hitpoints of this monster, this number will be set to the current hitpoints of this monster. When this last number is higher than or equal to the protection of the given character and the character is not dead then the given character will be hit.
            character.takeDamage(getDamage())
      • When the given character dies, this monster will collect the treasures of that character
            collectTreasures(character)
        • Throws:
        DeadException - Throws this exception when the current monster is dead. | isDead()

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string containing all public data of this monster.

        Returns:
        Return a string containing all public data of this monster.
